name: time after time cowl
notes:
time after time cowl is soft & squishy and features a slip stitch rib pattern that looks great on either side. it uses super bulky weight yarn and includes instructions for 2 sizes: a 2-color long, infinity style (although you could use 2 skeins of 1 color if you prefer) and a 1-color short, neck warmer style.

fast & fun, time after time is an enjoyable, relaxing knit and makes a great gift-making project for all knitting levels. 

pattern is available for free as my holiday gift to you! 

> check out my [time after time tips
> page][1] for:
> * info/tips on how to adjust pattern for different gauges
> * tips about working the stitch pattern
> * other technique tutorials

**pattern details:**

**finished measurements:**
*long version:* 57”/145 cm circumference x 7”/18 cm height
*short version:* 26.75”/68 cm circumference x 7”/18 cm height

**yarn:** 
super bulky weight yarn, shown in [super bulky by hedgehog fibres][2] (100% merino wool; 150g = 89 yds). quantities listed below:
* **long version:** 89 yds each of 2 colors (178 yds total), shown in kelp (color a, 1 skein) and liebling (color b, 1 skein).
* **short version:** 89 yds of 1 color, shown in plume (1 skein).

**gauge:** 9 sts & 14 rnds = 4”/10 cm in st pattern*
*exact gauge is not critical but it will affect your finished measurement and yarn usage.

**needles & other supplies:**
* *long version:* us 15/10 mm 32”/80 cm circ, or size needed to obtain gauge. 
* *short version:* us 15/10 mm 24”/60 cm circ, or size needed to obtain gauge.
* 1 stitch marker.
* tapestry needle to weave in ends.


  [1]: https://elizabethsmithknits.com/timeaftertime-tips/
  [2]: https://www.woolandcompany.com/yarn/super-bulky/hedgehog-fibres-super-bulky/
